definitions.example: We lit the fire to get some heat.

definitions.definition: To set fire to; to set burning.
To illuminate; to provide light for when it is dark.
definitions.example: I used my torch to light the way home through the woods in the night.

definitions.definition: To become ignited; to take fire.
definitions.example: This soggy match will not light.

definitions.definition: To attend or conduct with a light; to show the way to by means of a light.
To make (a bonus) available to be collected by hitting a target, and thus light up the feature light corresponding to that bonus to indicate its availability.
definitions.example: Light the extra ball by amassing 500 million points in the wizard mode.

definitions.definition: To unload a ship, or to jettison material to make it lighter
To lighten; to ease of a burden; to take off.

definitions.example: I lit upon a rare book in a second-hand bookseller's.

definitions.definition: To stop upon (of eyes or a glance); to notice
To alight; to land or come down.
definitions.example: She fell out of the window but luckily lit on her feet.
